meanings.sent1: I don my jacket before going outside.
meanings.sent2: She dons her hat to protect herself from the sun.
meanings.sent3: Why don't you don your superhero cape and save the day?
meanings.sent4: The sky dons a beautiful sunset every evening.
meanings.sent5: Donning warm gloves in winter keeps my hands cozy.

meanings.definition: A respected leader or expert in a particular field
meanings.sent1: The professor is a don in the field of physics.
meanings.sent2: The don of the village is highly respected by all.
meanings.sent3: The don of the chess club always wins against everyone.
meanings.sent4: She is the don of the baking world, known for her delicious cakes.
meanings.sent5: The don of the orchestra conducts with great skill and passion.

meanings.definition: To give or put on (an article of clothing)
meanings.sent1: Don the scarf to stay warm in the chilly weather.
meanings.sent2: He dons his favorite tie for important meetings.
meanings.sent3: Don't forget to don your party hat for the celebration!
meanings.sent4: The tree dons its colorful leaves in the fall.
meanings.sent5: Donning a smile can brighten someone's day.

meanings.definition: A Spanish title prefixed to a man's given name
meanings.sent1: Don Miguel is a well-known artist in the community.
meanings.sent2: The title 'Don' is a mark of respect in Spanish culture.
meanings.sent3: Don Juan always greets everyone with a warm smile.
meanings.sent4: She jokingly called him 'Don Diego' after watching a Spanish show.
meanings.sent5: The character in the story was referred to as 'Don Pedro' throughout.
